segments.text: I see the water just pouring out of the sink, and the woman is completely oblivious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is standing on that stool like it’s the most normal thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just waiting for her cookie, and it’s kind of cute.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman is going to slip any second now, but she doesn’t seem to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cookie jar is almost empty, and the boy is still reaching for more.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The light from the window makes the whole scene feel so calm, but it’s anything but.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how much water is on the floor, and she’s still drying dishes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool is wobbling, and I’m just waiting for the crash.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman’s dress is so neat, but her kitchen is a mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the kids will get away with it or if she’ll turn around and catch them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so perfect, like nothing bad could ever happen there.
segments.speaker: PAR
